title: can we do quarkus regular checking async or find some way to avoid it blocking user flow?

labels.name: area/devtools
labels.description: Issues/PR related to maven, gradle, platform and cli tooling/plugins

body:
### Description

calling quarkus cli I either get:

`Looking for the newly published extensions in registry.quarkus.io`

or the message about quarkus plugin needing syncing.

Somehow it always manages to do it at the most inappropriate times.
This is particular annoying when its during a demo at a conference or simply when working
while not connected to the fastest internet.

Can we do some of this async in background or at least consider giving user option to say no/cancel it so they don't need to wait? 

This issue become more dominant now that both quarkus plug and quarkus create wants to check.





### Implementation ideas

Do the fetching in the background/async and let user type in 'c' in console to cancel or simply pressing enter to cancel in case cached data is available. 

Something like:

```
Looking for the newly published extensions in registry.quarkus.io
Press <Enter> to cancel and use 26 hours old data...
```
